name: Rest Variants
description: Two variant rest systems that alter the pacing and resource management of the game. Epic Heroism shortens rests for fast-paced, action-heavy campaigns. Gritty Realism lengthens rests for survival-focused, resource-scarce campaigns.

variants.name: Epic Heroism

shortRest.description: A Short Rest takes only 1 minute instead of the standard 1 hour

longRest.description: A Long Rest takes only 1 hour instead of the standard 8 hours

variants.bestFor: High-action campaigns with frequent encounters and little downtime, where the party faces many battles in rapid succession
variants.effect: Characters recover resources much faster, allowing more encounters per adventuring day without resource depletion

variants.name: Gritty Realism

shortRest.description: A Short Rest takes 8 hours (equivalent to a standard Long Rest in duration)

longRest.description: A Long Rest takes 7 days of downtime in a safe location

variants.bestFor: Survival, exploration, and wilderness campaigns where resources are scarce and each encounter carries lasting consequences
variants.effect: Characters must carefully manage spell slots, Hit Dice, and class features across multiple days of adventuring

mechanics.generalNotes: All features that reference Short Rest or Long Rest use the variant durations. Features that recharge 'at dawn' or after a specific time period are unaffected.

interactions: Epic Heroism makes Short Rest classes (Warlock, Fighter, Monk) less distinctive since Long Rest classes also recover quickly
Gritty Realism makes Short Rest classes relatively stronger since they recover features in 8 hours while Long Rest classes must wait 7 days
Spellcasters are significantly impacted by Gritty Realism as spell slot recovery takes a full week
The Catnap spell (which grants a Short Rest in 10 minutes) becomes extremely valuable under Gritty Realism
Healing spells and potions become much more important in Gritty Realism since natural Hit Dice healing requires 8 hours
Encounter design must be adjusted: Epic Heroism supports more encounters per session, Gritty Realism supports fewer but more impactful ones
